snippet: The police pushed protesters out of a park using pepper spray and wrestled some of those who resisted to the ground.
abstract: Hundreds of Hong Kong police officers deploy pepper spray to scatter hundreds of demonstrators who had barricaded a harbor-front road overnight; clash is the most intense confrontation since early days of pro-democracy protests, further escalating tensions as authorities demonstrate growing impatience.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Alan Wong and Michael Forsythe contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The police pushed protesters out of a park using pepper spray and wrestled some of those who resisted to the ground.

headline.main: Violent Clashes Between Police and Demonstrators Erupt in Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: Violent Clashes Between Police and Demonstrators Erupt in Hong Kong
